title: Angels In America: Perestroika (National Theatre Live)
originalTitle: Angels In America: Perestroika (National Theatre Live)
overview: America in the mid-1980s. In the midst of the AIDS crisis and a conservative Reagan administration, New Yorkers grapple with life and death, love and sex, heaven and hell. This new staging of Tony Kushnerâ€™s multi-award winning two-part play, Angels in America: A Gay Fantasia on National Themes, is directed by Olivier and Tony award winning director Marianne Elliott.
